total_impedance_ori_txt: R4 and R5 connected in series so Rc=R4+R5=2 Ohm
R7 and R2 connected in series so Rf=R7+R2=2 Ohm
R1 and Rf connected in parallel so Re=R1*Rf/(R1+Rf)=1 Ohm
Re and R3 connected in series so Rd=Re+R3=2 Ohm
Rc and Rd connected in parallel so Rb=Rc*Rd/(Rc+Rd)=1 Ohm
Rb and R6 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R6=2 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 2 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R4 and R5 connected in series so Rc=R4+R5=2 Ohm
R7 and R2 connected in series so Rf=R7+R2=2 Ohm
R1 and Rf connected in parallel so Re=R1*Rf/(R1+Rf)=1 Ohm
Re and R3 connected in series so Rd=Re+R3=2 Ohm
Rc and Rd connected in parallel so Rb=Rc*Rd/(Rc+Rd)=1 Ohm
Rb and R6 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R6=2 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 2 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R1?

solution: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R4 and R5 connected in series so Rc=R4+R5=2 Ohm
R7 and R2 connected in series so Rf=R7+R2=2 Ohm
R1 and Rf connected in parallel so Re=R1*Rf/(R1+Rf)=1 Ohm
Re and R3 connected in series so Rd=Re+R3=2 Ohm
Rc and Rd connected in parallel so Rb=Rc*Rd/(Rc+Rd)=1 Ohm
Rb and R6 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R6=2 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 2 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R1
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 6 V.
(1) The components Rb,R6 connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 6 V.
(1) Rb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rb is Rb/Ra*6 V = 3 V.
(2) The components Rc,Rd connected in parallel. The voltage on Rd is 3 V because the voltage on Rb is 3 V
(3) The components Re,R3 connected in series.
(3) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 3 V.
(3) Re is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Re is Re/Rd*3 V = 1.5 V.
(4) The components R1,Rf connected in parallel. The voltage on R1 is 1.5 V because the voltage on Re is 1.5 V
